subject: Add notification popups for battery, memory events
commitMessage:
Add notification popups for battery, memory events

Calls to syspopup, which have been removed by the previous
commit, are now replaced by calls to libnotification which
will generate GUI popups via notification-service.

Some calls use the new notification response wait/send APIs
to interact with the user.

Change-Id: I4f35e4b2b83b9ac278c3d531251d09cc8c86b7fb
Author: Christophe Moreau <christophe.moreau@open.eurogiciel.org>
Signed-off-by: Manuel Bachmann <manuel.bachmann@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

Hi,

I just submitted a patchset to remove a now useless call to "/usr/bin/lowbatt-popup" ; as lowbatt-popup is not in the image anymore, it would always fail.

Patch Set 2:

Is this work relevant since system-server is going away and will be replaced by deviced?

Patch Set 2:

Mikko,

I thouth that we need to have the same changes for deviced.

Do you know when deviced will replace system-server?

THanks

Patch Set 2:

Jiyoung Yun, can you answer the question please

Patch Set 2:

Hi,

In doubt, we have begun to do some work on deviced :

https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/31194/

This patch fixes the "deviced" package build under Common ; there are also source-code patches (similar to this one) nearing completion.

Maybe we could push functionally-equivalent patches for both packages at the same time, so a future transition would be smooth ?

Patch Set 2:

Hi
Could you see the deviced code ? 
https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/admin/projects/platform/core/system/deviced
System-server will be replaced to deviced soon.

And i think it's better to seperate code btw UI and core logic code. Because UI tends to depend on UX so it can be different as target or user scenario. So I want deviced does not have any UI elements instead we need another module to be responsible for drawing basic system UI like system-popup.

Please check the deviced code and if you are against my comments please tell me :) Thank you!

Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Please check my comments.

Patch Set 2:

Hi,

Let me give you my point of view.

Tizen 3 uses a different popup system than Tizen 2.
Syspopup is no more used (https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TC-1476).
The reasons are that syspopup is dependent from a particular graphical toolkit (EFL for instance).

>> i think it's better to seperate code btw UI and core logic code.

We agree with that. In this patch syspopup calls are replaced by notification CAPI calls. There is no UI calls and logic. This patch just sends notifcations to notification-service and waits for its reply.

Then there is a new module notification-display-service that aims to display received notifications as popups according to the graphical toolkits in place (for the moment, it displays Wayland or X window popups). The goal is to have some popups that can be displayed by any homescreen type (EFL, Qt, HTML5, ...).


Finaly, this patch is proposed in system-server as it is deployed right now. We know that deviced will replace system-server and it is a good thing. I guess that will occur after IVI/Common releases.

Btw, before merging, we will need to adapt deviced to notifications popup as well.

subject: Add call to notification-service, performs charge error management, set events for notification-service plugin if necessary
commitMessage:
Add call to notification-service, performs charge error management, set events for notification-service plugin if necessary

Tizen 3 should use a popup system that does not depend on a graphical toolkit

Bug-Tizen: TC-1476

Change-Id: I49a5c6d40c1724ce9b5469236f08ddf549345a47
Signed-off-by: Christophe Moreau <christophe.moreau@open.eurogiciel.org>
